system.biography:
TitleFFF 804a Gargu-Viasal Warrior
Birthday5 Halane 707
AppearanceAge 12, height 3’8”, heavy frame (size 3), weight 90 lb, ugly appearance, pallid complexion, dark red hair, red eyes
Medical/PsycheNo medical traits. Violent temper (Severe; berserk when stressed - test against WIL×1).
Size0
ArmorPlate vambrace on right arm, plain cloth leggings. Spear and mang.
Other EquipmentNone
Valuables50d in bronze earrings and piercings, magic amulet.
NotesThe amulet provides a magical invisible aura of protection against all weapon aspects (+8) for an attuned wearer. Non-gargun attuned to the amulet will gradually take on the characteristics and behavior of a gargun. For more details, see the “Amulet of Feazurk” artifact page.

Biography

Feazurk’s thirst for slaughter is renowned, even for one from a race known for its bellicose nature. His battle lust is cause for concern for kings and fellow warriors, who are afraid to be near the unhinged gargun when the slightest provocation sets him raging at anything nearby. Doubtless, the whole hive will breathe a collective sigh of relief when the savage warrior finally meets his death in battle.

Feazurk has always been unstable, a fact easily noticed (at least by other gargun) in his wild eyes, perpetual drooling, and episodes of maniacal shouting and screaming. All gargun give him a wide berth to avoid being within reach during one of his bouts of rage. His berserker rage is an asset to the hive in its frequent clashes with other tribes and neighboring humans. This benefit is offset, however, when madness causes him to rampage and kill due to some slight provocation. Fortunately for the colony’s king, Feazurk’s madness prevents him from formulating plans of usurping the kingship.

The current king has found that regularly keeping Feazurk involved in bloodletting puts him in a more lucid mood; the hive actively hunts for anything that might present Feazurk a challenge.

Feazurk wears a magic amulet that he took as a prize after murdering another gargun for snoring. Although Feazurk does not understand its properties, he believes it protects him. He now goes about naked, especially in battle. When in one of his nearly mindless homicidal states, Feazurk revels in a feeling of invincibility as weapons bounce from his dirty hide and relishes the looks of fear and surprise he sees in his opponents’ eyes during the heat of battle.

HOOKS

Rrrrraaaaarrrr! The PCs are beset by a screaming, naked red orc who wades through the combat heedless of personal danger. Doubtless, they’ll be shocked as blades and arrows bounce off his naked hide.

Two Orcs Enter, One Orc Leaves! The king has run out of warriors willing to challenge Feazurk in death matches. He orders his warriors to capture anything that might be thrown into the pit with Feazurk to keep the berserker occupied in bloodletting.

Who Will Rid Me of this Troublesome Orc! Feazurk’s madness threatens the hive when he starts eating princesses (rather than raping them like any decent orc). The king would rather not risk his hide confronting the berserker. The wily orc chieftain instead concocts a plan to use humans to get rid of the troublesome warrior once and for all.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
